text: Question 1.15 (a) In the base 8 = 7, with t > 2, we have § = 1/7° + 1/7*, which will be written as 1.1 x 7° in this system. (b) A rational number can be written as p/q, where p and g > 0 are both integers. So using the base B = q with ¢ large enough but finite gives an exact floating point representation. Likewise, it can be seen that any floating point representation translates into a rational number. An irrational number such as 7 cannot be written this way, so no exact floating point representation is possible.
